revised_title: Nuclear DNA Variation and Chromosome Sizes in Acridid Grasshoppers
tldr: This study examines nuclear DNA variation and chromosome sizes in acridid grasshoppers. It found that DNA amount varies threefold among species, and chromosome size is closely correlated with nuclear DNA amount. The research also discovered a striking uniformity in the relative sizes of chromosomes within complements, despite the large-scale variation in DNA amount and chromosome volume. The study suggests that the uniformity may be maintained despite disproportionate distribution of DNA changes within chromosomes, indicating a possible adaptive importance of a particular distribution of chromosome material within complements.
